div.p:
Important Information for BCPS Parents and Students:
During their scheduled April Board meeting, the Board approved the following Promotion/Credit criteria for Burke County Public School students.
*Promotion for students in grades Pre-K through 8th:
All students in grades Pre-K through 8th will be promoted to the next grade. The standards missed at the end of this school year will be taught at the beginning of the 2020-2021 school year. Teachers will continue distance learning to help students, at minimum, maintain their current level of mastery.
*Promotion for students in grades 9th through 12th:
Students’ Q3 grade will be their final grade. All students, however, will have the opportunity to improve their 3rd nine weeks grade, and no student’s grade will be negatively impacted.
The end of school date remains the same, which is May 22. Please be on the lookout for more detailed information from your child’s school.
*BCHS Graduation:
Graduation plans will be set following the announcement from Governor Kemp on April 25, 2020.
*Meal Update:
Beginning Monday, April 27, 2020, Waynesboro Primary School, Blakeney Elementary School and the Sardis Park will serve as meal pickup locations from 10:00 am – 1:00 pm. Anyone 18 and under will be served.
Please have children present when picking up meals.
We hope to start running our bus meal deliveries again soon, but pick-up is the best we can offer at this time.

The Burke County Public School System, in conjunction with guidance from B. Lamar Murray Public Health Center, is being proactive in protecting the public from COVID-19.
Through contact investigations, 2 confirmed cases of COVID-19 have been identified. Potential exposure may have occurred around April 1st or later. Upon the direction of DPH, The Burke County Public School System has decided to suspend all activities, including meal delivery, while further investigations are on-going. Updates will be provided as information becomes available.

h1.a: BCPS and Pope Construction Receiving Bids for BCMS Renovations

section.p: Burke County Public Schools and Pope Construction Company, Inc. will receive bids for Burke County Middle School Renovations on Tuesday May 5, 2020 at 2:00pm. Plans, specifications and addenda will be available at no cost at www.popeconstructionco.com; subcontractor registration is required prior to accessing plans. Plans, Specifications and Addenda will also be available in the iSqFt plan room. It is the proposer’s responsibility to check for and acknowledge all addenda prior to submission of bids. Questions shall be directed to Bill Vickery, Project Manager & Estimator via fax or email only, 912-764-9408, bvickery@popeconstructionco.com

The Burke County School District will continue Distance Learning activities for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year in compliance with the executive order issued by Governor Brian Kemp. Thank you for your continued patience and support.

All parents are encouraged to participate in the Georgia Parent Survey because the data will be used as part of the calculation of the School Climate Star Rating. The Georgia Parent Survey link is posted below:
https://gshs.gadoe.org/parents
